body:
This PR resolves the issue with https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/677
@vorburger and @awasum please can you review this.
Something is failing.

This is the 2nd PR I've sent and Travis keeps failing, all tests work
locally for the 2 PRs.

I've also checked other PRs with failed travis CI and the error seems to be
thesame.

Perhaps we need to troubleshoot that.

    java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException at ClientSavingsIntegrationTest.java:1977

Please go see the travis log and see 1 integration test failing.

See line number: https://travis-ci.org/apache/fineract/builds/657603142#L3638

you can always debug or troubleshoot yourself.its easy.
it's OK now, not sure what was wrong before but it got resolved by itself
@awasum or @vorburger could you review this.
@percyashu , Please squash these 3 commits into 1.
@awasum OK I will do that
@awasum I have squash them.
@percyashu you can close this now since it has already been resolved in another PR
@vorburger what's lacking to merge this PR?

Please @xurror and @percyashu . Fix one issue before moving to another. The issues will not run away and more beginner issues can always be created if they get finished. Fineract has a lot of bugs which needs fixing so dont go about opening alot of PRs without actually finishing them and wasting our time and your energy. Please, pick one issue and work on them for a few days or week before picking another one after u have TRIED EVERYTHING and asked for help...then you can move to pick something else...Please
Please....run ./gradlew clean build and ./gradlew clean integrationTest on your local environment before sending PRs. if you do, you realise that there is a Checkstyle voilation on this PR.

Looks like you have a spotbugs violation and possibly a Checkstyle voilation in this PR. Opening and closing n times may not solve this. run ./gradlew clean check to see the problem and fix them on local Dev env before sending PR:

See: https://travis-ci.org/apache/fineract/builds/658740697#L1963

You can also check the logs online via Travis.. Do you understand what I mean?
This still failing...Check the Travis logs.

THanks for the PR @thesmallstar .

Please fix the checkstyle issue here: https://travis-ci.org/apache/fineract/builds/659110350?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification

Each time run ./gradlew clean build check before sending a PR..to make sure everything works on your local Dev env.

@awasum ,I am currently traveling, will do the required changes asap.
Thanks- Manthan

@luckyman20  and @vorburger , when you get the time, review this and merge at your discretion.
Everything looks good from my end...this requires some functional testing.

Thanks for working on this! I'd love to get this ready to merge.

So the Checkstyle violation seems to have been fixed, and as far as I can tell from the latest log `integrationTest `passes here now - great! It's just failing in the final `docker-compose` test, see `README.md` and last line in `.travis.yml` for how to launch that locally.  The reason for that is related to the required changes review feedback I just posted - does it make sense?
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-850

This still fails due to a hopefully simple to fix SpotBugs violation problem.  This failure has nothing to do with the problems we are chasing in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-850 and sub-tasks.

Also note the just merged https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/710 which will cause minor merge conflicts with this one which you should manually resolve when doing the required rebase when you work on this next.

LGTM! @xurror the only thing missing was that I hadn't noticed that you fixed this... :smile: In the future when you fix up a PR (and ideally only after it actually passes the build..) please "tag" (@vorburger) me with a short line such as "fixed and all good now (build passing), could you re-review" kind of comment.

> This still failing...Check the Travis logs.

not sure if related to this PR, or flaky general problem... see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-852, needs more investigation. @xurror do you want to have a closer look at what could be causing those ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, and comment on that JIRA? Or just rebase and retry building this to see if it goes away?

Thanks.
Makes a lot of sense.
Will send update soon

> Since, it is in where clause this probably need not be verified (I have researched, but would still require a confirmation from mentors).

Reading e.g. https://www.sqlinjection.net/tutorial/, I don't think it's true in general that "Since, it is in where clause this probably need not be verified" ... however, looking more into the code:

For the change (removal of SQL validation to prevent injection) in `AuditReadPlatformServiceImpl` we can see that `retrievePaginatedAuditEntries()` is only ever called from `AuditsApiResource`'s `retrieveAuditEntries()`, where the `extraCriteria` are constructed in `getExtraCriteria()`, which itself already uses `ApiParameterHelper.sqlEncodeString()` for all String args, so removing `validateSqlInjection()` for `extraCriteria` looks safe, to me (but, again, **NOT** because "it's just a WHERE", but because it seems to previously have been checked already).

For the other proposed change in `AuditsApiResource.getExtraCriteria()` I'm much more sceptical, because that `actionName` which is currently `ApiParameterHelper.sqlEncodeString` which does a `SQLInjectionValidator.validateSQLInput`, but which with this change wouldn't do that anymore,   comes straight from the outside world user as String parameter {{actionName}} in {{retrieveAuditEntries()}} ... removing that seems dangerous, to me.

I'm not entirely sure what a better solution is. I'd welcome more eyes on this though, and will email the list for additional input.

PS: Whatever solution we end up ultimately identifying and accepting, IMHO it could be useful for future code archaeology to include (a summary or copy/paste of) above into the commit message?

@thesmallstar this is an interesting problem, and I got unexpectedly :smile_cat: motivating to have closer look into what an "ideal" (correct) solution to this problem in general would have to look like... I have an idea I'm trying out myself, will share if I get anywhere interesting. Please don't let this block you, we can work in parallel; in fact I would be very interested in your view and feedback and perhaps testing, if I find an alternative worth looking at (FYI I don't actually have a full set up to be able to really reproduce and test FINERACT-808 fully end-to-end, although I think I kind of understood what the problem is).

@vorburger 
Update(not final but helpful conclusions): 
For SQL injection to be possible inside a where query: 
(something I tested): 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42006277/76166260-4be30280-6183-11ea-869f-6f1e002278c1.png)

Here we expected the parts in city Paris with weight 17, SQL injection would end the quote and then add a semicolon(and maybe a new query ahead). We skipped the validation: city = Paris (This could have been a password?)

Now, in `sqlEncodedStringWithoutValidation` we add a quote to the start and end (since we need an initial quote and an end quote.
this made the search query from 17'; to (start)'17(end)';'  next we replace each ' with  ' ' -> '17' ';' this would escape the quote that means we could not end the initial start of the search string, the new search query would be (start)'17;' '(end)(in all cases). 

**Use of double quotes?**
Should not be a problem, SQL injection needs to use a single quote(since we append a single quote).

Well, I could not still remove **probably**, but :P probably we would not need the keywords to be compared in this special case? :P

Edit: I am still trying and researching, will update accordingly.

@thesmallstar I'm curious if (and how) you like this idea / approach... it's obviously very much inspired by your work in #723!  If you do do like this, and are in favour of this approach, then you can "LGTM" this PR, and perhaps would be willing to close your #723 ?  

If you are further interested in the general topic of security and SQL injections, you would be very very welcome to continue working in this area! Some ideas: 1. Implement the `TODO` about the `toString()` in `SQLBuilder`[`Test`] (which I didn't have time for); 2. similarly change `CenterReadPlatformServiceImpl`'s and `GroupReadPlatformServiceImpl`'s remaining use of `ApiParameterHelper.sqlEncodeString` to this approach (and then delete `sqlEncodeString`), and then more work as described in [FINERACT-854](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-854)...

I am very satisfied with this approach(I would have tested it and update).
I am willing to work on the files and issue you mentioned 😄
Thanks - Manthan

@wkk91193 that line is just an INFO, like many other such lines, you can just safely ignore that. The real reason for the build failure on this PR are simply 14 Checkstyle violations in 4 of your files, you can see them by clicking on the Details link above (on the right side of "continuous-integration/travis-ci/pr — The Travis CI build failed") and then scrolling down. These are easy to see locally as well if you build locally before pushing to GitHub, which is always a good idea.
@thesmallstar  Have u been able to test this with the front end? So you pull this PR to a branch and run this with the front end to see if the issue is solved functionally.

This is just a rebase of  #719 from @xurror and @percyashu and I'm just curious if this passes... I ran this locally x3 times, and it failed with https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-855 every time - may be that is not just a flaky test, but really something that this PR breaks, for some (strange, yes) reason.

NB that other PRs passed today (e.g. #723 and #725) so if this still fails, perhaps the new RestAssured version is somehow changing some timing or something which causes IT test failures?!
Now this failed due to yet another new IT failure, see [FINERACT-857](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-857)..

@vorburger  @awasum 
The API is not working  with any action name filter, Status code: 500 
message: "criteria column name must match [a-z]: aud.action_name ="

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42006277/76213027-c701f280-622f-11ea-8771-acc93afce24b.png)

Note: it is working fine without any filter:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42006277/76213142-0a5c6100-6230-11ea-942e-6960a8dc5d8e.png)

I am trying to find the bug.
Edit: The problem is with regex, trying to fix it.

thanks- Manthan

Oh I see the problem, that's really easy to fix: That ATOZ RegExp in my new class SqlBuilder is much too strict.. it should allow (match) not only a-z but also . and - and _ and.. maybe a few more special characters that typically appear in column names. Do you want to try adding that to fix? Once you have it working, you could push a new PR, with my original commit, and then a 2nd Fix commit attributing your work. PS: Get well first, don't work with fever, nobody is dying ;-) because of this bug, this can wait until you're feeling better.

@vorburger, yes I will fix it :) 
thanks - Manthan

@vorburger 

It turns out everything is a valid column name as long as we use it between quote :P
check this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42006277/76217325-3da2ee00-6238-11ea-99e8-ae40dce9ec83.png)


For our convenience though, we can limit it to this form of regex [validtablename.]validcolumnname
[ ] -> means optional, and valid table name and valid column name comes from: [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4977898/check-for-valid-sql-column-name)
Regex: [a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*

any suggestions?
Ok, checking this

@vorburger, I've made changes and this passes travis CI now. It was quite challenging to set a new name.

Please can you re-review?

I ran. /gradlew clean build, clean check and clean integrationtest on this locally and they all passed but travus still fails with duplicate values query exceptions and unable to execute queries.

And I can recall before @vorburger reviewed and requested clean up changes, it had passed travis test. The changes I made were just to remove commented dependencies and a duplicate import. 
I think the rest-assured update is but the failing test issue persists. We'll, that's my opinion
@awasum want to review this one? See the JIRA for some background.
@awasum want to review this one? See the JIRA for some background.
Closing as this was included in #729 (this plus a required fix).

@xurror actually I suspect that this probably now fails SpotBugs because it detects (many?) wrong log statements? We should just fix them all up, as part of this PR... I know it's a bit painful manual work, but "fixing all and immediately enforcing" is the only pattern that I know of to make something like this have any real lasting impact (similar to #715).

Thank you for the review, working on the required changes.
Thanks- Manthan
@vorburger I already resolved them earlier today, it was actually quite long and boring but I think it's ready for merge

> LGTM. Merging now.

@awasum forgot to actually click the merge button? :smile:

@vorburger No pain, I am willing to learn the correct way( I plan to stay with fineract for long :P)
1. Can you give a quick link to refer the correct formatting?
2. Please tell how can we optimize this? ( Maybe something I suggested in the Note above, replacing '?')
3. Want to help with the Checkstyle :D

PS re Checkstyle, see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-821, as per https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r40d39423999b55a4ac2fa96aba0a16b91f80ac9f8e4ecb4c372c61c8%40%3Cdev.fineract.apache.org%3E (also on https://markmail.org/message/hk42ip7feruoaooo), gradually fixing formatting problems allowing to enable new rules in https://github.com/apache/fineract/blob/develop/fineract-provider/config/checkstyle/checkstyle.xml is the way to go.

> > LGTM. Merging now.
>

Thanks. Was waiting for another merged PR to finish running the Post PR merge Travis task.
@vorburger,this is ready

Oh sh#% I should have squashed this before merging... it's "ugly" in the commit history, but too late; oh well, too bad, I'll remember next time. - Also I just noticed that this actually has a SpotBugs violation which now broke the build, but it's so trival I'll just go ahead and fix it in a new PR (instead of reverting).

We'll see if the build passes there (probably still not, we'll have to fix those integration tests).

Its breaking the build.
Try to fix root cause of build generally failing... Will you like to help? Please check flyway mismatch numbering problem with latest merge...

Maybe you can merge it?

I want to add, "repositories" are duplicated I just have put jcenter and 
mavencentral inside the same {} , also the java editor show the warning, 
by the way and many others, seems that for every task inside de 
build.gradle there are duplicates .

You can find in the attached document (shared as a link) in the PR how 
to add the variables in Travis, also it goes again

El 15/03/20 a las 4:15, Michael Vorburger ⛑️ escribió:
>
> *@vorburger* commented on this pull request.
>
> Could you rebase and squash into a single commit?
>
> I've also provided some first review feedback.
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> In fineract-provider/build.gradle 
> <https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/734#discussion_r392659100>:
>
> > @@ -145,6 +147,7 @@ group = 'org.apache.fineract'
>   buildDir = new File(rootProject.projectDir, "../build")
>   repositories {
>   	jcenter()
> +    mavenCentral()
>
> Are you sure this is needed? jcentral is (should be..) a superset of 
> mavenCentral, and already have anything that's on mavenCentral.
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> In .travis.yml 
> <https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/734#discussion_r392659231>:
>
> > @@ -61,5 +61,5 @@ script:
>   # using "&&" instead of several "-" means that integrationTest does not run if test fails,
>   # and Docker test does not run if integration test fails, which makes PR failure easier to understand.
>   # @see https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/job-lifecycle/#customizing-the-build-phase
> -  - ./gradlew --console=plain licenseMain licenseTest licenseIntegrationTest check  &&  ./gradlew --console=plain integrationTest  &&  sudo service mysql stop  &&  docker-compose build  &&  docker-compose up -d  &&  sleep 30s  &&  http --verify=no --timeout 240 --check-status get https://localhost:8443/fineract-provider/actuator/health
> +  - ./gradlew --console=plain licenseMain licenseTest licenseIntegrationTest check  && ./gradlew --console=plain integrationTest && ./gradlew --console=plain sonarqube -Dsonar.host.url=$SONAR_HOST_URL -Dsonar.organization=$SONAR_ORGANIZATION -Dsonar.projectKey=$SONAR_PROJECT_KEY -Dsonar.login=$SONAR_TOKEN -Dsonar.verbose=true --stacktrace &&  sudo service mysql stop  &&  docker-compose build  &&  docker-compose up -d  &&  sleep 30s  &&  http --verify=no --timeout 240 --check-status get https://localhost:8443/fineract-provider/actuator/health
>
> Where/how is SONAR_TOKEN etc. defined?

@vorburger I have replaced System.out with LOG statements, but Spotbug is bothered with log performance and suggesting some changes, Is there a way to solve this rather than going individually through all 200-250 lines?

> @vorburger I have replaced System.out with LOG statements, but Spotbug is bothered with log performance and suggesting some changes, 

Yeah, that's due to the JUST introduced #716, see [FINERACT-696](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-696) for background.

 > Is there a way to solve this rather than going individually through all 200-250 lines?

I pulled this locally and noticed there are 270 violations... too many to manually fix up? :smile: Do a bunch every day, instead of all together?

Alternatives I can think of could be to configure Checkstyle to not run this particular check on src/test and only src/main, but I think that will be a PITA to configure (you would need separate configuration files, and somehow tell the Gradle plugin to run different configs for different dirs; I'm not sure that's possible), and also confusing for future developers, so I wouldn't do that and keep it simple.

In terms of best use of time, what I would probably do if I were you is maybe pause this one, and first move on to gradually activating other Checkstyle checks, and then come back to this one later / at the end.

@vorburger I resolved all violation except does pertaining to replacing Joda.time with Java.time which will be handle in a PR to issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/FINERACT/issues/FINERACT-826.

This build breaks some checkstyle rules.
Can you check that out?

@xurror Just finished the checkStyleMain task , it seems like the IDE by its own does not picks up the file defined in config , plus it did not fix the files , had to do manually, should be a task where we can fix the files like fixCheckStyleMain 

though my test are still failing locally, but as I see they are passing on travis.

@vorburger, @percyashu There seems to be a rest-assured related problem here.
Test fails from this definition in all the test packages
`ResquestSpecification` requestSpec = new RequestSpecBuilder().setContentType(ContentType.JSON).build()`
Logs report of an AbstractMethodError. Not sure where thats coming from cause all the methods used are in the docs and are used as described.
@rrpawar96 any specific reason for using System.out.print() instead of a logger?

> @rrpawar96 So this is more like a checkStyle issue , you need to install the check style plugin in your IDE and use the checkstyle config , this seems like a most common, issue though in eclipse I verified it is unable to apply the check style fix automatically
> 
> @vorburger most probably we need some service which can do on its own, internally packaged or built inside
> 
> For now , @rrpawar96 you can use this, https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/cmdline.html#Command_line_usage
> 
> https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8409074/how-can-i-easily-fix-checkstyle-errors
> 
> Sadly in my case ,I had to do this manually.

Can you file a ticket for this?
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.

> What do think? Do you think this is a good and worthy Idea?

absolutely, please go for it. (I'm not sure it's a full GSoC project, but I would say start with this; I expect you'll probably be able to complete it sooner than you think - and then you can look for more work!)

Hello every one, could you elaborate on what exactly you are looking for here? Do you want to...

1. Just run Checkstyle on the CLI?  You don't have to use https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/cmdline.html#Command_line_usage for that, you can just use Gradle, no? If I'm missing something, please clarify.

2. Have Checkstyle in Eclipse? You can use https://checkstyle.org/eclipse-cs/ for that! You should be able just load [our checkstyle.xml](https://github.com/apache/fineract/blob/develop/fineract-provider/config/checkstyle/) into it. I have not tried that yet, but I don't see why that would not work. I'd love you to try it, and then contribute a PR documenting how to do this to https://github.com/apache/fineract#checkstyle. 

BTW importing config/fineractdev-eclipse-preferences.epf as documented on our README normally automatically does much of what our Checkstyle configuration requires for you already. If you just do that, you may not even need to install and set up the Eclipse Checkstyle plugin? Try both, and see what works best for you, and share what you learnt here and on the dev list.

Also I don't understand why you have 4 commits and 5 edited files. Ithought you were trying to update the readme alone.
Do you mind checking that??

Thanks for pointing this out.
Hope to see more contributions from you.
@vorburger please, any follow up on this?

I'll re-review this hopefully hopefully this weekend, tomorrow or day after.

>
Build fails on Travis...please resolve them before we can properly review and merge.

This needs functional review, @emmanuelnnaa  please can you check this.
Aside from that, I think this is OK.
@awasum hope you don't mind if I self merge this one?

@vorburger okay, on it.
Also sir, I have mailed you my gsoc proposal, can you please review it?

I've just fixed the compilation problem that somehow crept into `ReportMailingJobConfiguration` ... not sure how that happened, it built locally; perhaps that was a new class from a rebase? Doesn't matter, let's see if it passes now.

@awasum if this is green and you have no review objections, will you merge it?

> contribute a PR documenting how to do this

==> #747
Okay thanks @vorburger
Why is this not having Travis check?

Useful to point those out. 
LGTM.
I think it's OK to merge
